Profiles-types.xml

Raw XML (canonical form)

Base Types defined as profiles (implementation assistance, for validation, derivation and product development)

Raw XML

<Bundle xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
  <id value="types"/>
  <meta>
    <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
  </meta>
  <type value="collection"/>
  <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="integer"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/integer"/>
        <name value="integer"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for integer Resource: A whole number"/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="integer"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="integer"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type integer"/>
            <formal value="A whole number"/>
            <comments value="32 bit number; for values larger than this, use decimal"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="integer.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for integer"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:int"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="integer"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type integer"/>
            <formal value="A whole number"/>
            <comments value="32 bit number; for values larger than this, use decimal"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for integer"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:int"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="dateTime"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/dateTime"/>
        <name value="dateTime"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for dateTime Resource: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year
         or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated.
         The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds
         may be provided but may also be ignored.  Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="dateTime"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="dateTime"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type dateTime"/>
            <formal value="A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes
             are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types
             gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored.
              Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="dateTime.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for dateTime"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:xs:gYear, xs:gYearMonth, xs:date, xs:dateTime"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="dateTime"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type dateTime"/>
            <formal value="A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes
             are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types
             gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored.
              Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for dateTime"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:xs:gYear, xs:gYearMonth, xs:date, xs:dateTime"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="code"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/code"/>
        <name value="code"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for code Resource: A string which has at least one character and no leading
         or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the
         contents"/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="code"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="code"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type code"/>
            <formal value="A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where
             there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="code.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for code"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:string"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="code"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type code"/>
            <formal value="A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where
             there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for code"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:string"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="date"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/date"/>
        <name value="date"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for date Resource: A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).
         There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and
         date.  Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="date"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="date"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type date"/>
            <formal value="A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format
             is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date.  Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="date.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for date"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:xs:gYear, xs:gYearMonth, xs:date"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="date"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type date"/>
            <formal value="A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format
             is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date.  Dates SHALL be valid dates."/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for date"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:xs:gYear, xs:gYearMonth, xs:date"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="decimal"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/decimal"/>
        <name value="decimal"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for decimal Resource: A rational number with implicit precision"/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="decimal"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="decimal"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type decimal"/>
            <formal value="A rational number with implicit precision"/>
            <comments value="Do not use a IEEE type floating point type, instead use something that works like a true
             decimal, with inbuilt precision (e.g. Java BigInteger)"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="decimal.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for decimal"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:decimal"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="decimal"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type decimal"/>
            <formal value="A rational number with implicit precision"/>
            <comments value="Do not use a IEEE type floating point type, instead use something that works like a true
             decimal, with inbuilt precision (e.g. Java BigInteger)"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for decimal"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:decimal"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="uri"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/uri"/>
        <name value="uri"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for uri Resource: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource"/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="uri"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="uri"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type uri"/>
            <formal value="String of characters used to identify a name or a resource"/>
            <comments value="see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="uri.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for uri"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:anyURI"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="uri"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type uri"/>
            <formal value="String of characters used to identify a name or a resource"/>
            <comments value="see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for uri"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:anyURI"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="id"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/id"/>
        <name value="id"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for id Resource: Any combination of lowercase letters, numerals, &quot;-&quot;
         and &quot;.&quot;, with a length limit of 36 characters.  (This might be an integer, an
         unprefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)  Systems
         SHALL send ids as lower-case but SHOULD interpret them case-insensitively."/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="id"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="id"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type id"/>
            <formal value="Any combination of lowercase letters, numerals, &quot;-&quot; and &quot;.&quot;, with
             a length limit of 36 characters.  (This might be an integer, an unprefixed OID, UUID or
             any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)  Systems SHALL send ids as
             lower-case but SHOULD interpret them case-insensitively."/>
            <comments value="RFC 4122"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="id.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for id"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:string"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="id"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type id"/>
            <formal value="Any combination of lowercase letters, numerals, &quot;-&quot; and &quot;.&quot;, with
             a length limit of 36 characters.  (This might be an integer, an unprefixed OID, UUID or
             any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)  Systems SHALL send ids as
             lower-case but SHOULD interpret them case-insensitively."/>
            <comments value="RFC 4122"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for id"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:string"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <resource>
      <Profile>
        <id value="base64Binary"/>
        <meta>
          <lastUpdated value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        </meta>
        <text>
          <status value="generated"/>
          <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><!-- Snipped for brevity --></div>
        </text>
        <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/base64Binary"/>
        <name value="base64Binary"/>
        <publisher value="HL7 FHIR Standard"/>
        <telecom>
          <system value="url"/>
          <value value="http://hl7.org/fhir"/>
        </telecom>
        <description value="Base Profile for base64Binary Resource: A stream of bytes"/>
        <status value="draft"/>
        <date value="2014-12-30T10:55:31"/>
        <type value="base64Binary"/>
        <base value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Element"/>
        <snapshot>
          <element>
            <path value="base64Binary"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type base64Binary"/>
            <formal value="A stream of bytes"/>
            <comments value="A stream of bytes, base64 encoded"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="base64Binary.extension"/>
            <short value="Additional Content defined by implementations"/>
            <formal value="May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition
             of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is
             a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any
             implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL
             be met as part of the definition of the extension."/>
            <comments value="There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project,
             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
            <synonym value="extensions"/>
            <synonym value="user content"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Extension"/>
            </type>
            <isSummary value="false"/>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for base64Binary"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:base64Binary"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </snapshot>
        <differential>
          <element>
            <path value="base64Binary"/>
            <short value="Primitive Type base64Binary"/>
            <formal value="A stream of bytes"/>
            <comments value="A stream of bytes, base64 encoded"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>
            <type>
              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>
          </element>
          <element>
            <path value="value"/>
            <representation value="xmlAttr"/>
            <short value="Primitive value for base64Binary"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="1"/>
            <type>
              <code value="xsd:base64Binary"/>
            </type>
          </element>
        </differential>
      </Profile>
    </resource>
  </entry>

          <system value="url"/>

             Time zone is always required"/>
            <min value="0"/>
            <max value="*"/>

              <code value="Element"/>
            </type>

             or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
              The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of
             simplicity for everyone."/>
